title: jQuery Cheat Sheet
description: This website displays useful jQuery methods in color coded sections based on what those methods do. Clicking on a method brings the user to the jQuery documentation page for that method.

title: The official jQuery API documentation site
description: This is the official jQuery API docs site, with all you'll ever need to know to work with jQuery

title: Responsive Web Design
description: This is a great article about responsive web design using CSS, with a focus on the mobile-first approach

title: Colin Grist's personal page
description: This is a web designer's personal portfolio page that he built. I like the design a lot and I am using it as inspiration for my own portfolio page.

title: Git Cheat Sheet
description: Forgot the Git command you need right this second? Head over to this page for a list of the most commonly used Git commands to help you out.

title: Command Line Cheat Sheet
description: This is a list of commonly used commands for the terminal. It has been helpful in getting me up to speed in the terminal.

title: Repl.it
description: Use this site for real-time JavaScript code experimentation. Built in console allows for immediate assessment of the code you write.

title: Oh-My-ZSH
description: GitHub repository for a well-crafted terminal shell that I have been using.

title: Chart-JS
description: This JavaScript API allows the user to output their data on the screen in nicely designed charts and graphs.

title: SMACCS
description: SMACCS is a web design philosophy that... (need to fill this out)

title: Flexy Boxes
description: Want to learn how to use flex boxes? Head to this site to play around with flex boxes on the screen in real-time.

title: Flex Box Froggy
description: Make frogs land on the correct lily pad in 24 increasingly more difficult levels using flexbox styling. Good for practice with flex boxes.

title: JSON Linter
description: Check to see if your JSON is valid with this site, very handy.

title: Mozilla Developer Network
description: THE site to visit when you are wondering about anything related to JavaScript. It has helped me tremendously while learning Javascript.

title: Google Maps API
description: Want to add a map on your site? Go here to learn how to get started with the Google Maps API.

title: Stack Overflow JavaScript
description: Check out Stack Overflow's latest JavaScript questions. Also any internet searching for code-related questions will inevitably lead you to Stack Overflow. I've learned a lot from this site.

title: Can I Use
description: Useful site that has browser support tables for different front-end web technologies. Check to see if the code you are writing will work in certain browsers.

title: Treehouse
description: Good site for tutorials in many different web development areas. I've used this quite a bit as a supplement to other learning.
